item.description:
Well - the % chance of rain on Saturday keeps going down, so I'm going to take a chance and schedule this walk. I have been wanting to walk the big loop at Ravenswood for a while now. There will be a place part way in for folks who want a shorter walk to turn off back to the main trails. Bring rainwear just in case. If it's drizzling we'll go. If a downpour will cancel. Since I have no Internet after 3pm on Friday, here is my cell 978-269-4232

Location : Ravenswood Park in Gloucester, MA Meet at the park entrance- Joan's silver Honda Fit

Hike Details : An easy 4.8 mile loop - Magnolia Swamp Trail to Fernwood Lake Trail to Ledge Hill Trail - which will take us 2.5 to 3 hours to complete.

Hiking boots are recommended, and it can't hurt to bring along bug spray. Dogs are allowed.

Directions: From Route 128, take exit 14 (Route 133) and follow east towards Gloucester for 3 mi. until it dead ends into Route 127. Turn right onto Route 127 and follow for 2 mi. to entrance and parking area (12 cars) on right. Also can park along the road if the lot is full.

Link: http://www.thetrustee...

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Ravenswood Park Hike - Saturday May 9th
